## Description {#details}

The classes here represent processor resource units and their management strategy.

These classes are managed by the Scheduler.

<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Used to notify the internal state of a processor resource.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><Highlight kind="comment">/// A processor resource is available if it is not reserved, and there are</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><Highlight kind="comment">/// available slots in the buffer.  A processor resource is unavailable if it</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><Highlight kind="comment">/// is either reserved, or the associated buffer is full. A processor resource</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><Highlight kind="comment">/// with a buffer size of -1 is always available if it is not reserved.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Values of type ResourceStateEvent are returned by method</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><Highlight kind="comment">/// ResourceManager::canBeDispatched()</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><Highlight kind="comment">/// The naming convention for resource state events is:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><Highlight kind="comment">///  &#42; Event names start with prefix RS&#95;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><Highlight kind="comment">///  &#42; Prefix RS&#95; is followed by a string describing the actual resource state.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="56" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/resourcestrategy/#a1e2b6442d33e00ce41448e655dc22697"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">virtual</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> uint64&#95;t <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/resourcestrategy/#a1e2b6442d33e00ce41448e655dc22697">select</a>(uint64&#95;t ReadyMask) = 0;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="57"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="58"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Called by the ResourceManager when a processor resource group, or a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="59"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// processor resource with multiple units has become unavailable.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="60"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="61"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The default strategy uses this information to bias its selection logic.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="62" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/resourcestrategy/#a8f5c6f9a9d50b1d06510d43a736e9be9"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">virtual</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/resourcestrategy/#a8f5c6f9a9d50b1d06510d43a736e9be9">used</a>(uint64&#95;t ResourceMask) &#123;&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="63"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="65"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Default resource allocation strategy used by processor resource groups and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66"><Highlight kind="comment">/// processor resources with multiple units.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/defaultresourcestrategy"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/defaultresourcestrategy/#a10cdf68ba23d403b70dd95f8d0f2023b">DefaultResourceStrategy</a> final : </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">public</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> ResourceStrategy &#123;</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// A Mask of resource unit identifiers.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// There is one bit set for every available resource unit.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="71"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// It defaults to the value of field ResourceSizeMask in ResourceState.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="72"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> uint64&#95;t ResourceUnitMask;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="73"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="74"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// A simple round-robin selector for processor resource units.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="75"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Each bit of this mask identifies a sub resource within a group.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="76"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// As an example, lets assume that this is a default policy for a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// processor resource group composed by the following three units:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   ResourceA -- 0b001</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   ResourceB -- 0b010</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   ResourceC -- 0b100</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Field NextInSequenceMask is used to select the next unit from the set of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// resource units. It defaults to the value of field &#96;ResourceUnitMasks&#96; (in</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// this example, it defaults to mask &#39;0b111&#39;).</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The round-robin selector would firstly select &#39;ResourceC&#39;, then</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="88"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// &#39;ResourceB&#39;, and eventually &#39;ResourceA&#39;.  When a resource R is used, the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// corresponding bit in NextInSequenceMask is cleared.  For example, if</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// &#39;ResourceC&#39; is selected, then the new value of NextInSequenceMask becomes</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="91"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// 0xb011.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// When NextInSequenceMask becomes zero, it is automatically reset to the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// default value (i.e. ResourceUnitMask).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95"><Highlight kind="normal">  uint64&#95;t NextInSequenceMask;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// This field is used to track resource units that are used (i.e. selected)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// by other groups other than the one associated with this strategy object.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="100"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// In LLVM processor resource groups are allowed to partially (or fully)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="101"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// overlap. That means, a same unit may be visible to multiple groups.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// This field keeps track of uses that have originated from outside of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// this group. The idea is to bias the selection strategy, so that resources</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="104"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// that haven&#39;t been used by other groups get prioritized.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="105"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The end goal is to (try to) keep the resource distribution as much uniform</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// as possible. By construction, this mask only tracks one-level of resource</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="108"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// usage. Therefore, this strategy is expected to be less accurate when same</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="109"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// units are used multiple times by other groups within a single round of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="110"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// select.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="111"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="112"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Note: an LRU selector would have a better accuracy at the cost of being</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// slightly more expensive (mostly in terms of runtime cost). Methods</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="114"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// &#39;select&#39; and &#39;used&#39;, are always in the hot execution path of llvm-mca.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="115"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Therefore, a slow implementation of &#39;select&#39; would have a negative impact</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="116"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// on the overall performance of the tool.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="117"><Highlight kind="normal">  uint64&#95;t RemovedFromNextInSequence;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="118"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="119"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">public</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="120" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/defaultresourcestrategy/#a10cdf68ba23d403b70dd95f8d0f2023b"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/defaultresourcestrategy/#a10cdf68ba23d403b70dd95f8d0f2023b">DefaultResourceStrategy</a>(uint64&#95;t UnitMask)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121"><Highlight kind="normal">      : ResourceUnitMask(UnitMask), NextInSequenceMask(UnitMask),</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="122"><Highlight kind="normal">        RemovedFromNextInSequence(0) &#123;&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="123" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/defaultresourcestrategy/#ae738360dc7fe17f32f3602264628f2dd"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">virtual</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/defaultresourcestrategy/#ae738360dc7fe17f32f3602264628f2dd">~DefaultResourceStrategy</a>() = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">default</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="124"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="125"><Highlight kind="normal">  uint64&#95;t <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/defaultresourcestrategy/#ae98cd9a61040a0208a29df6238b7aa08">select</a>(uint64&#95;t ReadyMask) </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">override</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="126"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/defaultresourcestrategy/#a37c31dd9225bfb63fd296560b380c2bd">used</a>(uint64&#95;t Mask) </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">override</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="127"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00128" /><CodeLine lineNumber="128"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="129"><Highlight kind="comment">/// A processor resource descriptor.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="130"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="131"><Highlight kind="comment">/// There is an instance of this class for every processor resource defined by</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="132"><Highlight kind="comment">/// the machine scheduling model.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="133"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Objects of class ResourceState dynamically track the usage of processor</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="134"><Highlight kind="comment">/// resource units.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="135" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/resourcestate"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/resourcestate">ResourceState</a> &#123;</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="136"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// An index to the MCProcResourceDesc entry in the processor model.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="137"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> ProcResourceDescIndex;</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00138" /><CodeLine lineNumber="138"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// A resource mask. This is generated by the tool with the help of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00139" /><CodeLine lineNumber="139"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// function &#96;mca::computeProcResourceMasks&#39; (see Support.h).</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00140" /><CodeLine lineNumber="140"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00141" /><CodeLine lineNumber="141"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Field ResourceMask only has one bit set if this resource state describes a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00142" /><CodeLine lineNumber="142"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// processor resource unit (i.e. this is not a group). That means, we can</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="143"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// quickly check if a resource is a group by simply counting the number of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00144" /><CodeLine lineNumber="144"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// bits that are set in the mask.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00145" /><CodeLine lineNumber="145"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00146" /><CodeLine lineNumber="146"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The most significant bit of a mask (MSB) uniquely identifies a resource.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00147" /><CodeLine lineNumber="147"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Remaining bits are used to describe the composition of a group (Group).</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00148" /><CodeLine lineNumber="148"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00149" /><CodeLine lineNumber="149"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Example (little endian):</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00150" /><CodeLine lineNumber="150"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///            Resource |  Mask      |  MSB       |  Group</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00151" /><CodeLine lineNumber="151"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///            ---------+------------+------------+------------</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00152" /><CodeLine lineNumber="152"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///            A        |  0b000001  |  0b000001  |  0b000000</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00153" /><CodeLine lineNumber="153"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                     |            |            |</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00154" /><CodeLine lineNumber="154"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///            B        |  0b000010  |  0b000010  |  0b000000</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00155" /><CodeLine lineNumber="155"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                     |            |            |</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00156" /><CodeLine lineNumber="156"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///            C        |  0b010000  |  0b010000  |  0b000000</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00157" /><CodeLine lineNumber="157"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                     |            |            |</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00158" /><CodeLine lineNumber="158"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///            D        |  0b110010  |  0b100000  |  0b010010</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00159" /><CodeLine lineNumber="159"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00160" /><CodeLine lineNumber="160"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// In this example, resources A, B and C are processor resource units.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00161" /><CodeLine lineNumber="161"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Only resource D is a group resource, and it contains resources B and C.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00162" /><CodeLine lineNumber="162"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// That is because MSB(B) and MSB(C) are both contained within Group(D).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00163" /><CodeLine lineNumber="163"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> uint64&#95;t ResourceMask;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00164" /><CodeLine lineNumber="164"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00165" /><CodeLine lineNumber="165"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// A ProcResource can have multiple units.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00166" /><CodeLine lineNumber="166"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00167" /><CodeLine lineNumber="167"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// For processor resource groups this field is a mask of contained resource</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00168" /><CodeLine lineNumber="168"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// units. It is obtained from ResourceMask by clearing the highest set bit.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00169" /><CodeLine lineNumber="169"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The number of resource units in a group can be simply computed as the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00170" /><CodeLine lineNumber="170"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// population count of this field.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00171" /><CodeLine lineNumber="171"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00172" /><CodeLine lineNumber="172"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// For normal (i.e. non-group) resources, the number of bits set in this mask</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00173" /><CodeLine lineNumber="173"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// is equivalent to the number of units declared by the processor model (see</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00174" /><CodeLine lineNumber="174"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// field &#39;NumUnits&#39; in &#39;ProcResourceUnits&#39;).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00175" /><CodeLine lineNumber="175"><Highlight kind="normal">  uint64&#95;t ResourceSizeMask;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00176" /><CodeLine lineNumber="176"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00177" /><CodeLine lineNumber="177"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// A mask of ready units.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00178" /><CodeLine lineNumber="178"><Highlight kind="normal">  uint64&#95;t ReadyMask;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00179" /><CodeLine lineNumber="179"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00180" /><CodeLine lineNumber="180"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Buffered resources will have this field set to a positive number different</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00181" /><CodeLine lineNumber="181"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// than zero. A buffered resource behaves like a reservation station</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00182" /><CodeLine lineNumber="182"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// implementing its own buffer for out-of-order execution.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00183" /><CodeLine lineNumber="183"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00184" /><CodeLine lineNumber="184"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// A BufferSize of 1 is used by scheduler resources that force in-order</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00185" /><CodeLine lineNumber="185"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// execution.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00186" /><CodeLine lineNumber="186"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00187" /><CodeLine lineNumber="187"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// A BufferSize of 0 is used to model in-order issue/dispatch resources.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00188" /><CodeLine lineNumber="188"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Since in-order issue/dispatch resources don&#39;t implement buffers, dispatch</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00189" /><CodeLine lineNumber="189"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// events coincide with issue events.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00190" /><CodeLine lineNumber="190"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Also, no other instruction ca be dispatched/issue while this resource is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00191" /><CodeLine lineNumber="191"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// in use. Only when all the &quot;resource cycles&quot; are consumed (after the issue</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00192" /><CodeLine lineNumber="192"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// event), a new instruction ca be dispatched.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00193" /><CodeLine lineNumber="193"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">int</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> BufferSize;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00194" /><CodeLine lineNumber="194"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00195" /><CodeLine lineNumber="195"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Available slots in the buffer (zero, if this is not a buffered resource).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00196" /><CodeLine lineNumber="196"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> AvailableSlots;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00197" /><CodeLine lineNumber="197"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00198" /><CodeLine lineNumber="198"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// This field is set if this resource is currently reserved.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00199" /><CodeLine lineNumber="199"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00200" /><CodeLine lineNumber="200"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Resources can be reserved for a number of cycles.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00201" /><CodeLine lineNumber="201"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Instructions can still be dispatched to reserved resources. However,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00202" /><CodeLine lineNumber="202"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// istructions dispatched to a reserved resource cannot be issued to the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00203" /><CodeLine lineNumber="203"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// underlying units (i.e. pipelines) until the resource is released.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00204" /><CodeLine lineNumber="204"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/gvn-cpp/#ae8ec32a9818e9fd7c653c86bc0c4dc7ea453e6aa38d87b28ccae545967c53004f">Unavailable</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00205" /><CodeLine lineNumber="205"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00206" /><CodeLine lineNumber="206"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> IsAGroup;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00207" /><CodeLine lineNumber="207"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00208" /><CodeLine lineNumber="208"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Checks for the availability of unit &#39;SubResMask&#39; in the group.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00209" /><CodeLine lineNumber="209"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> isSubResourceReady(uint64&#95;t SubResMask)</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword"> const </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00210" /><CodeLine lineNumber="210"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> ReadyMask &amp; SubResMask;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00211" /><CodeLine lineNumber="211"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00255" /><CodeLine lineNumber="255"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Checks if there is an available slot in the resource buffer.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00256" /><CodeLine lineNumber="256"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00257" /><CodeLine lineNumber="257"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Returns RS&#95;BUFFER&#95;AVAILABLE if this is not a buffered resource, or if</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00258" /><CodeLine lineNumber="258"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// there is a slot available.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00259" /><CodeLine lineNumber="259"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00265" /><CodeLine lineNumber="265"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00266" /><CodeLine lineNumber="266"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Reserve a buffer slot.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00267" /><CodeLine lineNumber="267"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00268" /><CodeLine lineNumber="268"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Returns true if the buffer is not full.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00269" /><CodeLine lineNumber="269"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// It always returns true if BufferSize is set to zero.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00270" /><CodeLine lineNumber="270"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> reserveBuffer() &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00271" /><CodeLine lineNumber="271"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (BufferSize &lt;= 0)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00272" /><CodeLine lineNumber="272"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">true</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00273" /><CodeLine lineNumber="273"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00274" /><CodeLine lineNumber="274"><Highlight kind="normal">    --AvailableSlots;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00275" /><CodeLine lineNumber="275"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(AvailableSlots &lt;= </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static&#95;cast&lt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">&gt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">(BufferSize));</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00276" /><CodeLine lineNumber="276"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> AvailableSlots;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00280" /><CodeLine lineNumber="280"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> releaseBuffer() &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00293" /><CodeLine lineNumber="293"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00294" /><CodeLine lineNumber="294"><Highlight kind="comment">/// A resource unit identifier.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00295" /><CodeLine lineNumber="295"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00296" /><CodeLine lineNumber="296"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This is used to identify a specific processor resource unit using a pair</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00297" /><CodeLine lineNumber="297"><Highlight kind="comment">/// of indices where the &#39;first&#39; index is a processor resource mask, and the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00298" /><CodeLine lineNumber="298"><Highlight kind="comment">/// &#39;second&#39; index is an index for a &quot;sub-resource&quot; (i.e. unit).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00299" /><CodeLine lineNumber="299"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">typedef</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> std::pair&lt;uint64&#95;t, uint64&#95;t&gt; <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/mca/#a961b7aeaca000c803c0f4b1df4d26c27">ResourceRef</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00300" /><CodeLine lineNumber="300"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00301" /><CodeLine lineNumber="301"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// First: a MCProcResourceDesc index identifying a buffered resource.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00302" /><CodeLine lineNumber="302"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Second: max number of buffer entries used in this resource.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00303" /><CodeLine lineNumber="303"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">typedef</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> std::pair&lt;unsigned, unsigned&gt; BufferUsageEntry;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00304" /><CodeLine lineNumber="304"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00305" /><CodeLine lineNumber="305"><Highlight kind="comment">/// A resource manager for processor resource units and groups.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00306" /><CodeLine lineNumber="306"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00307" /><CodeLine lineNumber="307"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This class owns all the ResourceState objects, and it is responsible for</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00308" /><CodeLine lineNumber="308"><Highlight kind="comment">/// acting on requests from a Scheduler by updating the internal state of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00309" /><CodeLine lineNumber="309"><Highlight kind="comment">/// ResourceState objects.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00310" /><CodeLine lineNumber="310"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This class doesn&#39;t know about instruction itineraries and functional units.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00311" /><CodeLine lineNumber="311"><Highlight kind="comment">/// In future, it can be extended to support itineraries too through the same</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00312" /><CodeLine lineNumber="312"><Highlight kind="comment">/// public interface.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00313" /><CodeLine lineNumber="313"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/resourcemanager">ResourceManager</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00314" /><CodeLine lineNumber="314"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Set of resources available on the subtarget.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00315" /><CodeLine lineNumber="315"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00316" /><CodeLine lineNumber="316"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// There is an instance of ResourceState for every resource declared by the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00317" /><CodeLine lineNumber="317"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// target scheduling model.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00318" /><CodeLine lineNumber="318"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00319" /><CodeLine lineNumber="319"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Elements of this vector are ordered by resource kind. In particular,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00320" /><CodeLine lineNumber="320"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// resource units take precedence over resource groups.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00321" /><CodeLine lineNumber="321"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00322" /><CodeLine lineNumber="322"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The index of a processor resource in this vector depends on the value of</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00323" /><CodeLine lineNumber="323"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// its mask (see the description of field ResourceState::ResourceMask).  In</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00324" /><CodeLine lineNumber="324"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// particular, it is computed as the position of the most significant bit set</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00325" /><CodeLine lineNumber="325"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// (MSB) in the mask plus one (since we want to ignore the invalid resource</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00326" /><CodeLine lineNumber="326"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// descriptor at index zero).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00327" /><CodeLine lineNumber="327"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00328" /><CodeLine lineNumber="328"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Example (little endian):</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00329" /><CodeLine lineNumber="329"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00330" /><CodeLine lineNumber="330"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//             Resource | Mask    |  MSB    | Index</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00331" /><CodeLine lineNumber="331"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//             ---------+---------+---------+-------</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00332" /><CodeLine lineNumber="332"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//                 A    | 0b00001 | 0b00001 |   1</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00333" /><CodeLine lineNumber="333"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//                      |         |         |</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00334" /><CodeLine lineNumber="334"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//                 B    | 0b00100 | 0b00100 |   3</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00335" /><CodeLine lineNumber="335"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//                      |         |         |</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00336" /><CodeLine lineNumber="336"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//                 C    | 0b10010 | 0b10000 |   5</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00337" /><CodeLine lineNumber="337"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00338" /><CodeLine lineNumber="338"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00339" /><CodeLine lineNumber="339"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The same index is also used to address elements within vector &#96;Strategies&#96;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00340" /><CodeLine lineNumber="340"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// and vector &#96;Resource2Groups&#96;.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00341" /><CodeLine lineNumber="341"><Highlight kind="normal">  std::vector&lt;std::unique&#95;ptr&lt;ResourceState&gt;&gt; Resources;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00342" /><CodeLine lineNumber="342"><Highlight kind="normal">  std::vector&lt;std::unique&#95;ptr&lt;ResourceStrategy&gt;&gt; Strategies;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00343" /><CodeLine lineNumber="343"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00344" /><CodeLine lineNumber="344"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Used to quickly identify groups that own a particular resource unit.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00345" /><CodeLine lineNumber="345"><Highlight kind="normal">  std::vector&lt;uint64&#95;t&gt; Resource2Groups;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00346" /><CodeLine lineNumber="346"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00347" /><CodeLine lineNumber="347"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// A table that maps processor resource IDs to processor resource masks.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00348" /><CodeLine lineNumber="348"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvector">SmallVector&lt;uint64&#95;t, 8&gt;</a> ProcResID2Mask;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00349" /><CodeLine lineNumber="349"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00350" /><CodeLine lineNumber="350"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// A table that maps resource indices to actual processor resource IDs in the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00351" /><CodeLine lineNumber="351"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// scheduling model.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00352" /><CodeLine lineNumber="352"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvector">SmallVector&lt;unsigned, 8&gt;</a> ResIndex2ProcResID;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00353" /><CodeLine lineNumber="353"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00354" /><CodeLine lineNumber="354"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Keeps track of which resources are busy, and how many cycles are left</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00355" /><CodeLine lineNumber="355"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// before those become usable again.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00356" /><CodeLine lineNumber="356"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smalldensemap">SmallDenseMap&lt;ResourceRef, unsigned&gt;</a> BusyResources;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00357" /><CodeLine lineNumber="357"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00358" /><CodeLine lineNumber="358"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Set of processor resource units available on the target.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00359" /><CodeLine lineNumber="359"><Highlight kind="normal">  uint64&#95;t ProcResUnitMask;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00360" /><CodeLine lineNumber="360"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00361" /><CodeLine lineNumber="361"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Set of processor resource units that are available during this cycle.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00362" /><CodeLine lineNumber="362"><Highlight kind="normal">  uint64&#95;t AvailableProcResUnits;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00363" /><CodeLine lineNumber="363"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00364" /><CodeLine lineNumber="364"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Set of processor resources that are currently reserved.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00365" /><CodeLine lineNumber="365"><Highlight kind="normal">  uint64&#95;t ReservedResourceGroups;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00366" /><CodeLine lineNumber="366"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00367" /><CodeLine lineNumber="367"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Set of unavailable scheduler buffer resources. This is used internally to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00368" /><CodeLine lineNumber="368"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// speedup &#96;canBeDispatched()&#96; queries.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00369" /><CodeLine lineNumber="369"><Highlight kind="normal">  uint64&#95;t AvailableBuffers;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00370" /><CodeLine lineNumber="370"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00371" /><CodeLine lineNumber="371"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Set of dispatch hazard buffer resources that are currently unavailable.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00372" /><CodeLine lineNumber="372"><Highlight kind="normal">  uint64&#95;t ReservedBuffers;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00373" /><CodeLine lineNumber="373"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00374" /><CodeLine lineNumber="374"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Returns the actual resource unit that will be used.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00375" /><CodeLine lineNumber="375"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/mca/#a961b7aeaca000c803c0f4b1df4d26c27">ResourceRef</a> selectPipe(uint64&#95;t ResourceID);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00376" /><CodeLine lineNumber="376"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00377" /><CodeLine lineNumber="377"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/localizer-cpp/#a428090a453f41a199ef67fc3f2179fbc">use</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/mca/#a961b7aeaca000c803c0f4b1df4d26c27">ResourceRef</a> &amp;RR);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00378" /><CodeLine lineNumber="378"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a650dea4533083a886cec9f16d80356d9a123fead50246387983ee340507115ef4">release</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/mca/#a961b7aeaca000c803c0f4b1df4d26c27">ResourceRef</a> &amp;RR);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00380" /><CodeLine lineNumber="380"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> getNumUnits(uint64&#95;t ResourceID) </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00395" /><CodeLine lineNumber="395"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(ResourceID &lt; ProcResID2Mask.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectortemplatecommon/#a1c479a8c434377c2b8cb056bdfdfc201">size</a>() &amp;&amp;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00399" /><CodeLine lineNumber="399"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00400" /><CodeLine lineNumber="400"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Returns RS&#95;BUFFER&#95;AVAILABLE if buffered resources are not reserved, and if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00401" /><CodeLine lineNumber="401"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// there are enough available slots in the buffers.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00402" /><CodeLine lineNumber="402"><Highlight kind="normal">  ResourceStateEvent canBeDispatched(uint64&#95;t ConsumedBuffers) </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00403" /><CodeLine lineNumber="403"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00405" /><CodeLine lineNumber="405"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> resolveResourceMask(uint64&#95;t Mask) </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00406" /><CodeLine lineNumber="406"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00407" /><CodeLine lineNumber="407"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Acquires a slot from every buffered resource in mask &#96;ConsumedBuffers&#96;.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00408" /><CodeLine lineNumber="408"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Units that are dispatch hazards (i.e. BufferSize=0) are marked as reserved.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00409" /><CodeLine lineNumber="409"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> reserveBuffers(uint64&#95;t ConsumedBuffers);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00410" /><CodeLine lineNumber="410"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00411" /><CodeLine lineNumber="411"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Releases a slot from every buffered resource in mask &#96;ConsumedBuffers&#96;.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00412" /><CodeLine lineNumber="412"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// ConsumedBuffers is a bitmask of previously acquired buffers (using method</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00413" /><CodeLine lineNumber="413"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// &#96;reserveBuffers&#96;). Units that are dispatch hazards (i.e. BufferSize=0) are</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00414" /><CodeLine lineNumber="414"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// not automatically unreserved by this method.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00415" /><CodeLine lineNumber="415"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> releaseBuffers(uint64&#95;t ConsumedBuffers);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00416" /><CodeLine lineNumber="416"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00417" /><CodeLine lineNumber="417"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Reserve a processor resource. A reserved resource is not available for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00418" /><CodeLine lineNumber="418"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// instruction issue until it is released.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00419" /><CodeLine lineNumber="419"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> reserveResource(uint64&#95;t ResourceID);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00420" /><CodeLine lineNumber="420"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00421" /><CodeLine lineNumber="421"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Release a previously reserved processor resource.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00422" /><CodeLine lineNumber="422"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> releaseResource(uint64&#95;t ResourceID);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00423" /><CodeLine lineNumber="423"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00424" /><CodeLine lineNumber="424"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Returns a zero mask if resources requested by Desc are all available during</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00425" /><CodeLine lineNumber="425"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// this cycle. It returns a non-zero mask value only if there are unavailable</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00426" /><CodeLine lineNumber="426"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// processor resources; each bit set in the mask represents a busy processor</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00427" /><CodeLine lineNumber="427"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// resource unit or a reserved processor resource group.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00442" /><CodeLine lineNumber="442"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00443" /><CodeLine lineNumber="443"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Selects pipeline resources consumed by an instruction.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00444" /><CodeLine lineNumber="444"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This method works under the assumption that used group resources don&#39;t</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00445" /><CodeLine lineNumber="445"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// partially overlap. The logic is guaranteed to find a valid resource unit</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00446" /><CodeLine lineNumber="446"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// schedule, no matter in which order individual uses are processed. For that</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00447" /><CodeLine lineNumber="447"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// reason, the vector of resource uses is simply (and quickly) processed in</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00448" /><CodeLine lineNumber="448"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// sequence. The resulting schedule is eventually stored into vector &#96;Pipes&#96;.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00451" /><CodeLine lineNumber="451"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00452" /><CodeLine lineNumber="452"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Selects pipeline resources consumed by an instruction.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00453" /><CodeLine lineNumber="453"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This method works under the assumption that used resource groups may</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00454" /><CodeLine lineNumber="454"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// partially overlap. This complicates the selection process, because the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00455" /><CodeLine lineNumber="455"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// order in which uses are processed matters. The logic internally prioritizes</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00456" /><CodeLine lineNumber="456"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// groups which are more constrained than others.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
